scope.title: Filtering a dataset
scope.description: Filters allows a user to refine the data they want to display in a large dataset by removing any items that do not match their criteria.

pattern.content:
Filters can help a user find something they're looking for and see available options within a certain criteria. Primary filters give users the fastest way to find what they're looking for. When filters are applied, tags are added below the filters so that users can see the changes that are being applied to the dataset. Users can remove tags individually or for all filters. - include 1-2 primary filters above the dataset - prioritise filters by expected usage - choose the right filter pattern to meet user needs - remove tags feature as tags allow users to see the selections that are active and remove them easily - use long radio/checkbox groups - e.g. more than 10 items ## Filter input methods Filters need to work within a limited space, so consider using input methods that do not need much space, such as: - [Search input](/component/search-input) - [Text input](/components/text-input) - [Select](/components/select) - [Checkbox](/components/checkbox) - [Radio](/components/radio) - [Combobox](/components/combobox) - [Switch](/components/switch) - [Date picker](/components/date-picker) ## Filter patterns Filter patterns are available in 3 sizes to accommodate a wide range of use cases and data sets: - **Small:** 1-2 filters - **Medium:** 3-6 filters - **Large:** 6+ filters (coming soon) Filter sizes decision table Small Medium Number of filters 1-23-6 Number of primary filters 1-21-2 Tags display active filters NoYes Submission required NoNo
## Small filter pattern Small is intended for 1-2 filters that are visible and sit above the dataset. The small pattern is typically comprised of primary filters. [View Storybook preview](https://design-system.agriculture.gov.au/storybook/index.html?path=/story/patterns-data-filtering-and-sorting--small) ## Medium filter pattern Medium is intended to display 3-6 filters in an accordion that is opened and closed by a button. 1 to 2 of the most used filters should be displayed as the primary filters outside the accordion to make them easier and faster to access. Tags are added below the filters to show which are active and give the user an easy way to clear them. [View Storybook preview](https://design-system.agriculture.gov.au/storybook/index.html?path=/story/patterns-data-filtering-and-sorting--medium) ## Large filter pattern Coming soon.
